_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:45:21 using v0.9
title: How has life expectancy changed by gender?
analysis_commentary: The life expectancy of both genders has been increasing over time. On average, the life expectancy for females is higher than males by roughly five years. The gap between the genders has, however, been decreasing. In 1981, the life expectancy of females was six years higher than males; in 2011, this has decreased to four years.
data_source: Office of National Statistics, Health Data 2013
